pros: Program Director sets the tone for a supportive team culture!
cons: No cons at this time.

pros: Amazing supervisors and employees. Lots of support from HR.
cons: I feel that I have skills that are under utilized.

pros: Salary would be good if not for the hours
cons: Owner is a micromanaging gold medalist

pros: Everything that a startup gives, with challenges

pros: Enjoy my position and team

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grants Pass, OR
pros: Caring administration, great care staff, good money and benefits.
cons: Not a lot of opportunities for growth. Some staff doesn't have good boundaries.

job_title: Life Skills Coach in Medford, OR
pros: Wonderful organization with teamwork and opportunities for ongoing trainings and clinical support
cons: Can be stressful at times

pros: The team is awesome and the work is rewarding. Feel like a valued member of the team at Kairos
cons: Little to no room for growth unless you are located in Grants Pass. Low compensation

review_title: Excellent care for clients - Top Management is crazy!!!
pros: The work with clients was rewarding.  Compensation was on the low side, management acknowledged it. Benefits were ok, health, vision, dental, life, retirement but coverage was on the low end.  Some of the people working there are dedicated.  Earned leave was compensated when you leave.
cons: Management doesn't care how they treat their employees.  They say they are important - but in reality everyone is always on the edge of being fired.  If a problem arises, someone always gets blamed.  Image is the most important thing because of the grant and donation money.  The Board is hand-picked so they don't make any waves.  Management has no idea about the amount of time required to do the actual day-to-day work, so they continually believe that most employees are wasting time and the management continues to bury them in more paperwork.

review_title: Coast branch is a big mess. Just don't!
pros: The good part is if you have a sincere desire to help children, you can do that.
cons:
Management does little to facilitate communication and harmony within the office. You are pretty much on your own. Corporate refuses to deal won the coast branch in a timely manner, so help there is limited as well.
Mostly you stumble blindly and hope and pray you do the right thing.
If there is a conflict, upper management in spineless and take ma a "don't rock the boat approach". 
The training is utter bs and not helpful. Most is a huge waste of time and had little /no bearing on working with kids with severe behavioral issues.
CPS training is absurd and worthless for the most part for the crap you are expected to tolerate.

pros: Training, collaboration with other agencies in the area, local manager very present, does listen to concerns and upfront with expectations.
cons: As another post states, jobs are always on the line, you as an employee are replaceable. Management is easily manipulated because they wont go further than the person bringing them a problem and of course, there solution. Services to clients are not therapeutic, adopted theories and policies are ignored but as long as the paperwork is complete, its workable.

job_title: Therapist Intern in Grants Pass, OR
pros: Amazing company with amazing values. The people working for this company are the best people you will meet in your life. Everyone is caring and compassionate. The management truly cares about every employee and every client. There is a great amount of buy-in from every employee which makes this job feel like working with a family.
cons: Often very stressful work environment. Depending on the facility it could be considered highly stressful. The hours are often difficult and work-life balance can be difficult to manage at times. Management seems slightly disorganized at times resulting in inconsistent expectations. The pay and benefits are average for this field which is low for the level of experience and education required by state law.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grants Pass, OR
pros: fast-paced, never boring, lost weight I stayed so busy, time flew.
cons: No time for anything else, because "off time", you're exhausted, or they're asking you to work overtime. High turnover, because they let new people get burnt out. They interview that it's all about "teamwork". What they really mean is that they expect YOU to do what is asked of you, but not to ask "what can the team also do for me?"

job_title: Treetment Foster Parent in Grants Pass, OR
pros: Every person I have encountered working with Kairos has been outstanding. I have rarely encountered such dedicated, intelligent and personable people. They are very committed to helping these children, I have on many occasions seen staff members go above and beyond what is normally expected, while smiling.
cons: It is often a thankless job, however these children would be much worse off if they have not been in this program.

review_title: Don't Work here Don't Relocate to Work Here
pros: The youth served are wonderful and will inspire you to get up each day for work.
cons: Management is like a bad high school novel, gossip, mean girls, sexual topics of conversation, bullies and unkind treatment of the youth and management continues to overlook the staff that are abusive.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grants Pass, OR
pros:
The work you are doing is important and there are few jobs as rewarding as working with the clients.

The floor staff is outstanding.
cons:
Long hours, low pay due to state funding.
Thankless work.
Very little upward mobility.
Very inflexible with schedules and requests.
Little support from management.

pros: Really nice staff, caring and committed.
cons: They approach their work with a narrow vision doing what everyone else is doing.  Management does not think outside the box.  Fresh blood needed

pros: I can't really name any pros besides being able to help the people that are currently "living" there.
cons: It is very disorganized, I worked over ten hour days and was always asked to work on my days off. If you say no they treat you different. They like to find a person to stick the blame on when something goes wrong. It is never the person in charges fault.

pros: Fresh ideas.  Open door.  Feel like I'm heard.  Lots of needed change , especially at the senior staff level.
